heading: Purpose
text:
PLAY project researchers use KoBoToolbox collect data participant families.
Data sessions PLAY data collection sites pushed common set files KoBoToolbox server.document describes process ) downloading, ii) parsing, iii) cleaning, iv) exporting files forms suitable data analysis.details PLAY Project data collection protocol, see https://PLAY-behaviorome.github.io/protocol/.

heading: Overview of data sets
text:
three sets data collected using KoBoToolbox.
One set collected recruiting screening calls study.
second set collected home visit.
third set consists notes generated experimenter visit.

heading: Data access and processing
text:
data downloaded manipulated locally synched GitHub.
accomplished adding data .gitignore.separate processes detecting deleting personal identifiers specific data files exporting ‘cleaned’ versions may shared Databrary.

heading: Home visit data
text:
three (3) age groups (12-, 18-, 24-month-olds) four (4) different language environment groups (English-, Spanish-, Bilingual-English-dominant, Bilingual-Spanish-dominant).
Since language questions specific questions vary age group language environment group, multiple KoBoToolbox survey form files must processed.

heading: Setup
text: Load functions needed download KBT screening/demographic questionnaire files.
code:
fl <- list.files(file.path(here::here(), "R"), "^kobo_|^file_", full.names = TRUE)
purrr::walk(fl, source)

heading: Download
text:
two targets specified _targets.R handle regular downloading screening data files.First, generate data frame KoBoToolbox forms contain screening (“Demographic”) data.
target process:download save raw XLSX files ../data/xlsx/screening using kobo_retrieve_save_many_xlsx(kb_screen_df, save_dir = "../data/xlsx/screening").
Finally, convert XLSX files CSVs via file_load_xlsx_save_many_csv("../data/xlsx/screening", "../data/csv/screening", "Demographic").
latter two steps handled wrapper function screen_download_convert(kb_screen_df, "data/xlsx/screening", "data/csv/screening").
accompanying target:
code:
# Not evaluated
  tar_target(
    kb_screen_df,
    kobo_list_data_filtered("[Dd]emographic"),
    cue = tarchetypes::tar_cue_age(
      name = kb_screen,
      age = as.difftime(update_interval, units = update_interval_units)
    )
  ),# Download screening/demographic survey
  tar_target(
    screen_download,
    screen_download_convert(kb_screen_df, "data/xlsx/screening", "data/csv/screening"),
    cue = tarchetypes::tar_cue_age(
      name = screen_df,
      age = as.difftime(update_interval, units = update_interval_units)
    )
  ),

removing address information.Census queries stopped working around 2023-06-16.now, remove identifiers without querying Census.remove identifiable information using screen_remove_identifiers()., use dplyr::full_join() combine set individually

heading: Clean individual fields
text:
Now, can proceed clean-merged data frame.
sequence functions called cleans ‘construct-specific’ variables
indicated function names.convenience, package sequence function, screen_clean_fields().Note variables considered character strings. tidyverse
suite great job guessing variables , sometimes 
guesses wrongly. , preliminary stages, proved easier make everything
character string.work , version worth exporting.

    screen_clean_childcare_info() |>
    screen_clean_family_structure() |>

heading: Merge
text:
Let’s add Databrary volume ID info.filter rows valid volume IDs.\(n=\) 555 valid Databrary volume IDs total \(n=\) 565 screening records.Next, add play_status field based group-name field Databrary.
use group-name indicating “Gold”, “Silver”, “run.”Two targets _targets.R relevant operation:targets generate site-specific CSVs data/csv/site_sessions based database PLAY sites contained data/csv/_meta/play_site_vols.csv.
load CSVs data frame.group_name variable contains status information sessions.note three different versions visit: “visit”, “No_visit”, “No_Visit”.
addition, \(n=\) 59 sessions NA group_name.
sessions still QA scheduled, anomaly.
, want select sessions occurred passed QA–sessions group_name either ‘PLAY_Gold’ ‘PLAY_Silver’.information sharing status.one session marked PRIVATE.Now, join screening data Databrary session data.
code:
scr_df <- scr_df |>
  screen_add_db_vol_id()
valid_db_vol <- !is.na(scr_df$vol_id)

scr_df <- scr_df[valid_db_vol,]  tar_target(
    play_vols_df,
    readr::read_csv("data/csv/_meta/play_site_vols.csv",
                    show_col_types = FALSE)
  ),
  tar_target(
    databrary_session_csvs,
    purrr::map(play_vols_df$site_id, databrary_get_save_session_csv),
    cue = tarchetypes::tar_cue_age(
      name = databrary_session_csvs,
      age = as.difftime(update_interval, units = update_interval_units)
    )
  )

session_fns <-
  list.files("../data/csv/site_sessions", "\\.csv$", full.names = TRUE)

df_sessions <-
  purrr::map(
    session_fns,
    readr::read_csv,
    col_types = readr::cols(.default = 'c'),
    show_col_types = FALSE
  ) |>
  purrr::list_rbind()
xtabs(~ group_name, data=df_sessions)## group_name
##    No visit    No_visit    No_Visit   PLAY_Gold PLAY_Silver 
##           1          12          61         334          77
df_sessions <- df_sessions |>
  dplyr::filter(stringr::str_detect(group_name, "PLAY_"))
xtabs(~ group_name + session_release, df_sessions)##              session_release
## group_name    EXCERPTS PRIVATE SHARED
##   PLAY_Gold        256       0     78
##   PLAY_Silver       61       1     15
df_sessions |>
  dplyr::filter(session_release == "PRIVATE") |>
  dplyr::select(vol_id, session_id, session_name, group_name)## # A tibble: 1 × 4
##   vol_id session_id session_name   group_name 
##   <chr>  <chr>      <chr>          <chr>      
## 1 979    66932      PLAY_PRINU_024 PLAY_Silver
screen_datab_df <- dplyr::left_join(df_sessions, scr_df, by = c('vol_id', 'participant_ID'))

summarize_non_mbcdi_qs <- function(fn) {
  stopifnot(is.character(fn))
  
  if (!file.exists(fn)) {
    stop('File not found `', fn, '`')
  } else {
    df <- readr::read_csv(fn, show_col_types = FALSE)
    if (!is.data.frame(df)) {
      stop('Error reading data frame')
    } else {
      out_df <-
        tibble(
          file_name = basename(fn),
          n_rows = dim(df)[1],
          n_vars = dim(df)[2]
        )
      dplyr::arrange(out_df, file_name)
    }
  }
}

remove_technology_use_scale <- function(df) {
  dplyr::select(df, -contains('technology_use_scale'))
}

remove_doctor_told_you <- function(df) {
  dplyr::select(df, -contains('doctor_told_you'))
}

remove_databrary_fields <- function(df) {
  dplyr::select(df, -contains('group_databrary'))
}

reconcile_typicalday <- function(df) {
  names(df) <- stringr::str_replace_all(names(df), 'typicalday', 'typical_day')
  df
}

remove_permissive_locomotor_milestones_label <- function(df) {
  old_names <- names(df)
  new_names <- old_names
  contains_locomotor <-
    stringr::str_detect(new_names, pattern = "locomotor_milestones.*health|division|rothbart|mediause|pets|typical|acknowledge")
  new_names[contains_locomotor] <-
    stringr::str_remove(new_names[contains_locomotor], "group_locomotor_milestones\\.")
  names(df) <- new_names
  df
}

remove_X_meta_cols <- function(df) {
  dplyr::select(df, -contains("X_"), -contains("meta.instanceID"))
}

remove_redundant_group_labels <- function(df) {
  names(df) <- stringr::str_remove_all(names(df), 'group_homevisitquestionnaires\\.')
  names(df) <- stringr::str_remove_all(names(df), 'group_combinedquestionnaires\\.')
  df
}

clean_dfs <- function(df) {
  df %>%
    reconcile_typicalday() %>%
    remove_technology_use_scale() %>%
    remove_doctor_told_you() %>%
    remove_permissive_locomotor_milestones_label() %>%
    remove_databrary_fields() %>%
    remove_X_meta_cols() %>%
    remove_redundant_group_labels()
}
targets::tar_load(df_merge_287_cols_1, store="../_targets")
targets::tar_load(df_merge_287_cols_2, store="../_targets")
targets::tar_load(df_merge_288_cols, store="../_targets")

heading: Calls by site
text: Figure 2: Cumulative screening calls site
code:
calls_by_site_plot <- function(df) {
  df |>
    filter(!is.na(site_id)) %>%
    ggplot() +
    aes(fct_infreq(site_id), fill = site_id) +
    geom_bar() +
    theme(axis.text.x = element_text(
      angle = 90,
      vjust = 0.5,
      hjust = 1
    )) + # Rotate text
    labs(x = "site") +
    theme(legend.position = "none")
}

calls_by_site_plot(df)

extract_sleep_hr <- function(t) {
  t |>
    stringr::str_extract("^[0-9]{2}\\:[0-9]{2}\\:[0-9]{2}") |>
    hms::as_hms()
}

heading: Comments
text:
Manual inspection shows comments field names.
omit printing comments can assured identifiying information comments.
code:
ecbq_complete |>
  dplyr::select(participant_id, age_group, rothbart_comments) |>
  dplyr::filter(!is.na(rothbart_comments)) |>
  dplyr::arrange(age_group) |>
  knitr::kable(format = 'html')
